title: Hi, I'm Robert.
text:
Hi, I'm Robert.
            I am a Data Scientist with a passion for Immunology.
                I am currently a PhD candidate at Case Western Reserve University in Pathology.
            Please explore my CV or my Projects (scientific and personal), or just drop me a line.

title: Projects
text:
Code on GitHub
A project focused on implicating the Hexoseamine Biosynthetic Pathway and O-GlcNAcylation in AML.
Publication Pending

title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Projects
text:
Sorting Students into Groups
Code on GitHub
A simple project to make a GUI to sort students into groups using Rust. The purpose was: - I wanted for someone to be able to run this without having R or Python installed, - I wanted to learn a little bit of a compiled language, - My fianceé had a use for such a utility.

title: Projects
text:
Sorting Students into Random Groups
Code on GitHub
A simple project to make a CLI and GUI to sort students into groups using Rust. The purpose was:

I wanted for someone to be able to run this without having R or Python installed,
I wanted to learn a little bit of a compiled language, and
My fianceé had a use for such a utility.
